definition: to establish schools/to raise the standard of education
feeling or desire to do sth/interest in sth/excitement
to rise/to flourish/to become popular/to start/to encourage/to get up/(often used in the negative) to permit or allow (dialect)/maybe (dialect)

sentences.english: Metallogeny is an applied branch of the earth sciences.
sentences.chinese: 成礦學是地球科學中一門很有應用價值的新興學科。

sentences.english: Landscape architecture is a profession not more than one hundred years since its coming.
sentences.chinese: 景觀建築學是一門不過百年的新興學科。

sentences.english: There are three big-scale education innovations in Song Dynasty respectively, namely Qingli Education Innovations, Xining Education Innovations and Chongning Education Innovations.
sentences.chinese: 范仲淹慶曆興學掀開了宋代三次大規模興學的序幕。

sentences.english: There are three big-scale education innovations in Song Dynasty respectively, namely Qingli Education Innovations, Xining Education Innovations and Chongning Education Innovations.
sentences.chinese: 范仲淹慶曆興學掀開了宋代三次大規模興學的序幕。

sentences.english: Science of the human body is a new branch of natural science.
sentences.chinese: 人體科學是一門新興學科。

sentences.english: Green remanufacture engineering is a new subject in rapid development, whose main components include design foundation and engineering technology.
sentences.chinese: 綠色再製造工程是一個迅速發展中的新興學科。

sentences.english: Then three direct social terms are explained for "Setting up Schools During Chongning Period".
sentences.chinese: 其次闡明瞭“崇寧興學”的三個直接的社會條件。

sentences.english: Green reproducing project is a new subject in 21st century.
sentences.chinese: 綠色再製造工程是21世紀的一門新興學科。

sentences.english: Plant metabolic engineering is a rising science with developing prospect.
sentences.chinese: 植物代謝工程是一個很有發展前景的新興學科。

definition: see 念念不忘[nian4 nian4 bu4 wang4]
to help the poor/almsgiving for the needy/to assist poor households or poor regions
the hardships of beginning an undertaking (idiom)
to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom); striving to the utmost
model teacher of every age (idiom)/eternal paragon/refers to Confucius (551-479 BC) 孔子[Kong3 zi3]
